content:
• Tuesday, June 5, 2018
  • AMRS

    Amyris +2.9% after new amendment to loan/security agreement

    • Amyris (NASDAQ:AMRS) is up 2.9% in late trading after an 8-K filing indicates it's again amended its loan and security agreement.
    • On May 30 the company undertook the eighth amendment of its LSA with Stegodon Corp. (assignee of Hercules Capital) to extend the due date for a principal repayment of $5.5M to July 2 from May 31; Amyris is due for a fee of $100,000 if it doesn't make the July 2 date.
    • Amyris also amended a senior convertible R&D note for $3.7M, to extend its maturity date to July 2 from May 31.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • YY

    YY up 2.3% after revenues jump, company beats in Q1

    • YY is up 2.3% in postmarket Nasdaq trading after a beat on top and bottom lines in its first-quarter earnings.
    • Revenues rose 43% and non-GAAP net income attributable to the company rose 31.1% to 699.9M yuan (about $111.6M). On a GAAP basis, net income faell to 444.1M yuan from 543.2M yuan.
    • The company didn't detail usage but offered highlights: Mobile live streaming monthly active users rose 24% to 77.6M, and total live streaming paying users increased 17% to 6.9M.
    • Revenue breakout: Live streaming, 3.03B yuan (about $483.4M, up 47.4% in renminbi terms); Others, 216.9M yuan (about $34.6M, up 3.5%).
    • The company named Pengjun Lu as its chief technology officer, effective last week.
    • Conference call to come at 9 p.m .ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:41 PM | 23 Comments
  • HUYA

    Huya +5% as first report shows swing to gain, doubled revenues

    • Huya Broadcasting (NYSE:HUYA) is up 5% after hours following its Q1 results, its first as an independent public company.
    • Revenues more than doubled to 843.6M yuan (about $134.5M), and the company is projecting similar Y/Y growth for the current quarter.
    • Live streaming revenues were up 102% to 792.8M yuan. Advertising and other revenues grew 212% to 50.8M yuan.
    • The company swung to a net gain of 31.4M yuan (about $5M) vs. a year-ago loss of 41.7M yuan on a GAAP basis. Non-GAAP net income was 67.6M yuan (about $10.8M) vs. a year-ago non-GAAP net loss of 34.7M yuan.
    • Average monthly active users hit 92.9M (up 19.2%); average mobile MAUs were 41.5M (up 25%). Total paying users were 3.4M (up 34.9%).
    • For Q2, it's expecting total net revenues of 970M-1B yuan (Y/Y growth of 110-117%).
    • The company spun off via IPO last month at $12/share; the stock closed today at $29.72.
    • Conference call to come at 8 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:08 PM | 36 Comments
  • VBLT

    VBL Therapeutics +42% after presenting data on MOSPD2 platform

    • VBL Therapeutics (NASDAQ:VBLT) +41.8% after-hours following the company's presentation of positive data on its VB-600 platform of biologic drug candidates for MOSPD2 oncology and inflammation indications at the BIO International Convention in Boston.
    • CEO Dror Harats says VBLT's research has shown that "MOSPD2 plays a key role in the regulation of cell motility. We have generated data indicating that MOSPD2 is required for directional movement, or chemotaxis, of tumor cells and certain immune cells, and therefore appears to play a central role in both oncology and inflammation."
    • The CEO says VBL's data indicate that "knock-out of MOSPD2 in tumor cells may reduce metastasis by up to 95%."
     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM

  • KNOP

    KNOT Offshore Partners beats on revenue

    • KNOT Offshore Partners (NYSE:KNOP): Q1 net income of $30.7M
    • Revenue of $68.04M (+51.2% Y/Y) beats by $1.03M.
    • Shares +1.2% AH.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM | 69 Comments
  • IDT

    IDT +4% as headline losses decline in Q3

    • IDT is up 4% after hours following fiscal Q3 earnings where it narrowed GAAP losses despite flat revenues.
    • That 1.2% drop in revenues was due to a "loss of high volume but low margin wholesale carrier minutes and had no significant impact on our gross profit," says CEO Shmuel Jonas.
    • Cost of revenue dropped 2.4%, and while severance expense was up to $3.7M, loss from operations declined to $1.7M from a year-ago loss of $6.5M.
    • Net loss dropped to $3.5M from a year-ago loss of $4.8M.
    • Revenue by segment: TPS, $356.4M (down 1.6%); net2phone-UCaaS, $9.1M (up 23%).
    • Conference call to come at 5:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm, NXP move on report of a ZTE deal

    • Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) gains 1.5% aftermarket and NXP Semiconductors (NASDAQ:NXPI) drops 0.9% after a Reuters report that ZTE has signed an agreement with the U.S. to put it back in operation.
    • Positive tech relations between the US and China make it more likely that China will approve Qualcomm’s acquisition of NXP.  
    • Previously: Reuters: ZTE in deal with U.S. to restart business (June 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM | 40 Comments
  • GWRE

    Guidewire Software -2% on Q1 beat with 15% license revenue drop

    • Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE) drops 2% aftermarket on Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 14% Y/Y revenue growth. In-line Q4 guidance has revenue from $234M to $240M (consensus: $239.31M) and EPS of $0.72 to $0.77 (consensus: $0.74).
    • FY18 guidance has in-line revenue from $647M to $653M (consensus: $648.99M) and upside EPS from $1.05 to $1.11 (consensus: $1.01).
    • Key metrics: License and other revenue, $50.4M (-15% Y/Y); Services revenue, $71.4M (+50%); Maintenance revenue, $18.7M (+11%); income from operations, $2.3M; cash and equivalents, $1.6B. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: Guidewire Software beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (June 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 3 Comments
  • AMBA

    Ambarella +1.9% on Q1 beats, downside guidance

    • Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA) gains 1.9% aftermarket on Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 11% Y/Y revenue drop. Downside Q2 guidance has revenue from $60M to $64M (consensus: $68.18M) and gross margin from 59% to 61%.
    • Key metrics: Non-GAAP gross margin, 61.8% (-2.5% Y/Y); cash and equivalents, $414.1M; capital allocation, $20.6M in share repurchases; operating expenses, $44.8M. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:30 PM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: Ambarella beats by $0.04, beats on revenue (June 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 5 Comments
  • OLLI

    Ollie's Bargain -4% in initial post-earnings trades

    • Ollie's Bargain Outlet Holdings (NASDAQ:OLLI) reports comparable sales increased 1.9% in Q1.
    • Gross margin rose 10 bps to 40.9% of sales as merchandise margins headed higher. Operating income rose 32% to $36.0M and operating margin improved 110 bps to 13.1% of sales.
    • Adjusted EBITDA increased 27.7% to $41.0M during the quarter.
    • Ollie's CEO Mark Butler says early Q2 trends are looking encouraging.
    • Looking ahead, the company expects full year sales of $1.207B to $1.215B vs. $1.21B  consensus and comparable store sales growth of 1.0% to 2.0%. Ollie's plans to open 36 to 38 new stores this year.
    • OLLI -4.38% AH to $72.00.
    • Previously: Ollie's Bargain Outlet beats by $0.04, beats on revenue (June 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • NCS

    NCI Building Systems beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • NCI Building Systems (NYSE:NCS): Q2 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $457.07M (+8.7% Y/Y) beats by $19.16M.
    • Shares +5.15%.

  • ZTCOF

    Reuters: ZTE in deal with U.S. to restart business

    • ZTE (OTCPK:ZTCOF) has signed an agreement in principle with the United States that would put it back in business, Reuters reports.
    • The Commerce Dept. is denying that a definitive agreement has been signed by both sides.
    • The deal has a $1B fine along with $400M in escrow in case of future violations, according to the report. The $361M ZTE paid previously will be part of the agreement, allowing the U.S. to claim total penalties hit $1.7B.
    • Suppliers are moving after hours: ACIA +1.5%; OCLR +1.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 29 Comments
  • MDGL

    Madrigal Pharma down 2% after hours on mixed shelf filing

    • Madrigal Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MDGL) eases 2% after hours after it filed a prospectus for an unspecified mixed shelf offering.
    • Update: The company also announced a public offering of $200M of common stock. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional ~364K shares. Price and terms have yet to be released.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 7 Comments
  • IMGN

    ImmunoGen readies stock offering; shares off 3% after hours

    • ImmunoGen (NASDAQ:IMGN) slips 3% after hours on the heels of its planned public offering of 12M shares of common stock. Price and terms have yet to be released.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • WIN

    Analyst: Windstream's offered protections make second-lien debt more likely

    • The protections that Windstream (WIN +7.4%) is offering in its attempt to amend first-lien bonds could be enough to get support for issuing the second-lien debt it needs to address its balance sheet, CreditSights says.
    • Analyst Lindsay Gibbons tells Bloomberg that a consent solicitation expiring at 5 p.m. today has a consent fee and first-lien covenant caps that offer a "decent amount of comfort." The company has a limit on first-lien debt issuance, and issuing second-lien debt out of that first-lien cap puts a lid on leverage increases.
    • There's other comforts, too, like Windstream's cost-cutting and the potential for revenue growth from newer network tech: “Because they do have some of those levers to pull on, that could be enough to help induce an exchange, plus the general liquidity in the market."
    • Shares are down 41% YTD and down 76% over the past 12 months.
    • Previously: Windstream to offer $18M in shares via Citi (Jun. 01 2018)
    • Previously: Windstream launches consent solicitation on senior secured credit (May. 30 2018)
    • Previously: Windstream reportedly seeking credit amendment; shares -13.3% (May. 30 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 7 Comments
  • BIIB

    Eisai and Biogen's elenbecestat shows encouraging action in mid-stage Alzheimer's study

    • Biogen (BIIB -0.2%) and development partner Eisai (OTCPK:ESALY +2%) announce positive results from a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing BACE inhibitor elenbecestat in patients with mild-to-moderate Alzheimer's disease (AD).
    • Elenbecestat was generally safe and well-tolerated during the 18-month treatment period and demonstrated a statistically significant effect (reduction) on amyloid beta levels in the brain compared to placebo, the first study to show this effect. A numerical slowing of cognitive decline measures was also observed in the treatment group but it was not statistically significant.
    • Two Phase 3 trials, MISSION AD1 and AD2, are in process.
    • BACE inhibition for AD has encountered a couple of setbacks recently. Johnson & Johnson terminated its Phase 2b/3 study of atabecestat on toxicity concerns and Merck bailed on verubecestat due to lack of efficacy.
    • Previously: J&J bails on Alzheimer's candidate atabecestat on toxicity issues (May 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 4 Comments
  • NWS

    Murray succeeding Baker as top editor at Wall Street Journal

    • Matt Murray is taking on the title of Editor-in-Chief of The Wall Street Journal and Dow Jones Newswires (NWS +2.6%, NWSA +2.2%).
    • He's currently executive editor; he's taking over for Gerard Baker, who after 5.5 years is moving to a editor-at-large role with more outreach.
    • "Gerry has been a very successful editor at a time when journalism has been digitally challenged," says News Corp. CEO Robert Thomson. "I have no doubt that Matt is a worthy successor as Editor-in-Chief and will be a leader of the highest commitment and integrity."
    • Baker will write a regular weekend column, among other articles; host a WSJ-branded news/interview show on Fox Business; and take a bigger role in the company's live journalism/events business.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • NE

    Noble Corp. +2% as Bernstein upgrades on jack-up strength

    • Noble Corp. (NE +2.3%) is higher after Bernstein upgrades shares to Market perform from Underperform with a $5 price target, raised from $4, as analyst Colin Davies believes oil prices above $70/bbl will lead to a "moderate improvement offshore, particularly in the high specification jack-up segment."
    • Davies likes NE's strong exposure to the segment, where the market has found a floor and there is tentative evidence of rate improvement, and thinks further industry consolidation is likely with NE a potential consolidation candidate.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM | 13 Comments
  • AMAT

    Applied Materials announces Integrated Materials Solution for cobalt adoption

    • Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) announces a “breakthrough in materials engineering that accelerates chip performance in the big data and AI era.”
    • The Integrated Materials Solution combines dry clean, PVD, ALD, and CVD on Applied’s Endura platform to enable customers to speed the adoption of cobalt, which can increase performance up to 15% over tungsten and copper. 
    • Applied Materials shares are up 1.1% to $52.85.       
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 2 Comments

  • ANFI

    Amira Nature Foods +13% on elevated volume

    • Amira Nature Foods (NYSE:ANFI) jumps 12.88% on heavy volume.
    • Earlier, shares of Amira broke back over $3 for the first time since May 9.
    • Short interest on Amira is right around 19% of outstanding shares, adding to the daily volatility on the food stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • AMZN

    CNBC: Amazon's answer to Google X works on cancer research, medical records

    • Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) has a secretive group working on cancer research, medical records, and last-mile delivery, according to CNBC sources.
    • The group called Grand Challenge is a research team meant to explore new ventures that could expand the tech giant’s footprint like Alphabet’s Google X lab. Google X vet  Babak Parviz runs Grand Challenge. 
    • Grand Challenge has added over 50 people in the past four years. The organization is housed under AWS in the business sense and reports to AWS CEO Andy Jassy. 
    • A Challenge project called Hera involves taking unstructured medical record data to identify an incorrect medical code or a misdiagnosis. The group is starting to pitch Hera to commercial health insurance companies. 
    • Amazon shares are up 2% to $1,698.21. 
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 20 Comments
  • HMNY

    Another break lower for Helios and Matheson

    • Helios and Matheson Analytics (HMNY -7.5%) hits a new low of $0.3751 in another swing down.
    • The MoviePass owner's market cap is below $35M.
    • Yesterday, Seeking Alpha contributor Perfectvision laid out the company's path to a multi-billion dollar market cap for investors with plenty of time and faith.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 36 Comments
  • CBLK

    Carbon Black +8.2% ahead of earnings

    • Carbon Black (NASDAQ:CBLK) hits new highs today with shares reaching up to $26.47 before retreating a bit.
    • Carbon Black reports earnings on Thursday, the first report since the IPO in early May.   
    • The company preannounced Q1 results in its adjusted S-1 filing with non-GAAP operating loss of $11.5M to $12M and revenue from $47.5M to $48M (+33% Y/Y). 
    • Carbon Black shares are up 8.2% to $26.26.    
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • EBR

    Electrobras -7% after Brazilian labor court orders halt to privatization effort

    • Centrais Eletricas Brasileiras (EBR -6.9%) plunges after a Brazil labor court orders the state-run power company to suspend its ongoing privatization process and present a study within 90 days examining the impacts of the process on workers.
    • EBR, which is seeking to privatize itself and sell six distribution subsidiaries, says it "will analyze the appropriate measures and keep the market informed."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • FRED

    Retail sector gainers

    • More retail movers after a sudden burst of positive sentiment in the chain store sector include Fred's (FRED +7.7%), Burlington Stores (BURL +2.2%), Dollar Tree (DLTR +2.3%), Ollie's Bargain Outlet Holdings (OLLI +1%), Zumiez (ZUMZ +7.2%), Office Depot (ODP +5.6%), Stitch Fix (SFIX +4.9%), Five Below (FIVE +2.5%), Etsy (ETSY +3.3%), Michaels Companies (MIK +2.2%), Francesca's Holdings (FRAN +6.6%), Buckle (BKE +4.3%), L Brands (LB +3.2%), American Eagle Outfitters (AEO +3.7%), Stage Stores (SSI +1.5%), Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF +2.7%), Citi Trends (CTRN +2.2%) and Cato (CATO +1.6%).
    • Previously: Solid gains in the mall sector (June 5)

  • COTV

    Cotiviti jumps 10% on report of advanced sale talks

    • Cotiviti Holdings (NYSE:COTV) has spiked 10% as dealReporter says the company's in advanced sale talks with the help of Goldman Sachs.
    • Private-equity firms are involved and the company's expected to collect final bids in about two weeks, according to the report.
    • That could value the company about $4.5 in enterprise value, with leverage at 6.5 to 7 times EBITDA.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • IRDM

    Iridium builds maritime momentum; shares up 5%

    • Iridium Communications (IRDM +5%) is pointing to continued momentum from the recent approval for maritime safety of its network, saying it's adding several providers to its Certus service.
    • Seven new providers will provide Certus service for maritime applications: Globecomm, Network Innovations, Pivotel, MVS USA, IEC-Telecom, MetOcean and Samsan Enterprise.
    • The company's now working to introduce Global Maritime Distress Safety System service as soon as possible.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 5 Comments
  • ALOT

    AstroNova down 3% post Q1 results

    • AstroNova (ALOT -3%) reported Q1 revenue growth of 28.7% Y/Y to $31.5M, with domestic revenue $19.2M (+23% Y/Y) and international revenue $12.3M (+40% Y/Y).
    • Q1 Overall gross margin improved by 50 bps to 38.5% and operating margin improved 110 bps to 4%.
    • Segment results: Product identification revenue $20M (+7% Y/Y) and operating margin was down by 510 bps to 8.3%; Test & management revenue $11.5M (+98% Y/Y) reflecting the impact of the Honeywell asset purchase and licensing agreement, and operating margin improved by 1,840 bps to 19.6%.
    • Bookings increased 29% Y/Y to $33.3M from $25.8M.
    • Backlog was at $23.9M (+31% Y/Y) as of April 28, 2018.
    • “We continue to be positive on our expectations for fiscal 2019 with comparable sales and earnings in the second quarter and improving performance in the second half of the year as we wind down the Transition Services Agreement with Honeywell for our new Aerospace printer line as well as increased revenue contributions from our new TrojanLabel product lines,” commented Greg Woods President and CEO.
    • Previously: AstroNova reports Q1 results (June 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • SGYP

    New analysis affirms risk/benefit profile of Synergy's Trulance in CIC; shares up 5%

    • A new retrospective risk/benefit analysis from pooled Phase 3 trial data assessing Synergy Pharmaceuticals' (SGYP +4.7%) TRULANCE (plecanatide) and Allergan (AGN +0.8%) and Ironwood Pharmaceuticals' (IRWD -0.5%) LINZESS (linaclotide) in adult patients with chronic idiopathic constipation (CIC) showed the relative advantage of TRULANCE. The data were presented at Digestive Disease Week in Washington, DC.
    • A metric called "number needed to treat" or NNT, showing the number of patients that need to be treated to show a clinical benefit (low number is better), was comparable between TRULANCE 3 mg and LINZESS 72 mcg and 45 mcg.
    • Another metric called "number needed to harm" or NNH, showing the number of patients that need to be treated before seeing a detrimental effect (high number is better), favored TRULANCE. Its NNH value was almost 3x higher than its NNT values, implying that treated patients are three times more likely to experience a beneficial effect before experiencing a harmful effect.
    • The NNH values for LINZESS were lower than the NNT values implying that patients receiving either dose would most likely experience a harmful effect before experiencing a beneficial effect.
    • The FDA approved TRULANCE for CIC in January 2017.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 66 Comments
  • CLDC

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (06/05/2018)

    • Gainers: CLDC +18%. CARV +7%. BFR +7%. SUPV +6%.
    • Losers: IHT -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar -11.5% over two days, capped by BAML downgrade

    • First Solar (FSLR -5.4%) suffers a second straight sharp loss after BofA Merrill Lynch downgrades shares to Neutral from Buy with a $63 price target, slashed from $83, following the Chinese government's move to cut subsidies and halt construction on new solar farms.
    • BAML anticipates a steep drop in 2018 Chinese solar deployments following China's actions, with further declines possible in 2019-20, and expects the decline in Chinese demand and expanded supply to depress prices globally and cause a "deluge" of Chinese imports into the U.S.
    • The firm forecasts FSLR's margins to decline from 35% in 2019 to 20% by 2022, but with some near-term support from the existing order book and fixed-price contracts; FSLR shares have shed 11.5% this week.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 35 Comments
  • SDT

    Sandridge Mississippian Trust I +30% to 52-week high

    • Sandridge Mississippian Trust I (SDT +28.2%) skyrockets to its highest level in more than a year, with no news available to explain the spike that occurred at around 11:30 a.m.
    • The move comes on more than 10x the normal daily volume of just 143K shares, with half the trading day still ahead.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 15 Comments
  • GBPT

    Capital Art shoots up 49% post Q1 results

    • Capital Art (CAPA) reports Q1 revenue growth of 266.7% Y/Y to $0.55M of which License revenue was 0.23M (+360% Y/Y) & Image revenue of 0.32M (+190.9% Y/Y).
    • Total operating expenses were reduced by 22% to $0.2M, due to lower G&A costs and primarily from lower professional fees.
    • The company expanded third-party & reseller programs, doubling number of third party resellers & using social media more on direct-to consumer-programs.
    • Also, launched development of a management software system to more efficiently ingest images & distribute them through retail & licensing channels.
    • Deployed new digital technology to track where and how the company’s images are used.
    • Cash & equivalents of $7.5K (+476.9% Q/Q) & Net income totaled to $71K.
    • Previously: Capital Art reports Q1 results (June 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM

    Midday Gainers / Losers (06/05/2018)

    • Gainers: CODX +41%. NDRA +28%. SDT +32%. SNES +25%. CLDC +19%. ABEO +15%. NX +16%. ANFI +15%. ACIU +15%. SMAR +15%.
    • Losers: OTC:ANW -72%. BDR -24%. TEDU -22%. TROV -15%. ESEA -10%. EDUC -10%. EBR-B -10%. GCO -10%. CRIS -9%. OTCPK:LFIN -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 2 Comments
  • TSRO

    TESARO teams up with Roche to evaluate triplet therapy for ovarian cancer

    • TESARO (TSRO +2.4%) will collaborate with Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY -1.4%) unit Genentech on a clinical study evaluating the combination of ZEJULA (niraparib), TECENTRIQ (atezolizumab) and COTELLIC (cobimetinib) in patients with platinum-sensitive ovarian cancer.
    • The study, expected to launch by year-end, will be conducted by Genentech.
    • The companies are also collaborating on the combination of ZEJULA and TECENTRIQ in metastatic bladder cancer as part of Roche's immunotherapy development platform MORPHEUS.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • TPR

    Kate Spade found dead in apparent suicide

    • Well-known fashion designer Kate Spade was found dead in her apartment this morning after she apparently hung herself, according to police sources.
    • Kate Spade sold the last of her shares in her eponymous company in 2006, well-before it was sold to Tapestry (TPR -1%).
    • Shares of Tapestry broke sharply lower after the news broke, but have since recovered a bit.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 4 Comments
  • ANW

    Aegean Marine -70% on $200M writedown news; World Fuel could take share

    • Aegean Marine Petroleum (OTC:ANW -71.1%) is crushed following news late yesterday that it may need to write off $200M of accounts receivable owed to the company after an internal probe uncovered possible wrongdoing with its finances.
    • Seaport Global analyst Kevin Sterling views the news as a "crippling blow" to ANW as selling bunker fuel is a working capital intensive business, with receivables the company's lifeline and major asset.
    • Sterling says ANW is "severely weakened," providing an opportunity for competitor World Fuel Services (INT +1.7%) to pick up additional market share, as well as the potential for pricing to have an upward bias.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 20 Comments
  • ATV

    Acorn International -17% in latest wild swing

  • PBR

    Reality sets in as Brazil government meddling looms over new Petrobras CEO

    • Petrobras (PBR -1.5%) jumped nearly 6% yesterday following the appointment of former CFO Ivan Monteiro as its new CEO - helped also by some bargain hunting after huge losses over the previous two weeks - but analysts say the new boos will not likely be able to escape government pressure.
    • Monteiro, seen by oil companies and investors as an avid supporter of changes sought by the departed Pedro Parente, is not expected to get the same carte-blanche from the government as his predecessor, as the political mood in Brazil has shifted.
    • "Monteiro will be under serious political pressure because of the elections,” says University of Rio de Janeiro energy professor Edmar Almeida. “Candidates who are against asset sales, for example, will push hard against any major Petrobras decision on divestments."
    • More is at stake for PBR than potential losses from fuel pricing, as possible investors could be scared away from bidding on stakes in four of PBR's refineries because of the prospect of competing with a company that is forced to sell fuel below cost.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 13 Comments

    • Allergan (AGN +1.5%) is up, albeit on below-average volume, on the heels of the publication of recent communications from long-term institutional investors Appaloosa LP and Senator Investment Group LP to the board. They have lost their patience with management's "half-hearted attempt to restore strategic momentum," dialing up the heat on Chairman/CEO/President Brent Saunders.
    • The stockholders are urging action to stem the stock's extended slide, down almost 40% in a year, and rekindle growth. Minimum recommendations:

    • Replace at least two additional directors.
    • Upgrade management talent in critical operating units.

    Reuters: China investigating DRAM companies for price fixing

    • A Reuters source confirms Chinese regulators are investigating the top DRAM companies for alleged price fixing.
    • The investigation is targeting Micron (NASDAQ:MU), Samsung (OTC:SSNNF, OTC:SSNLF), and
      SK Hynix (OTC:HXSCF, OTC:HXSCL).
    • Key quote from the source: “The investigation has kicked off in earnest.”
    • The rising cost of chips has hurt Chinese electronics manufacturers that operate at lower margins than overseas rivals.
